page.title: 16COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: As part of our sub-topic we made a visit to Barnsley main post office. It is situated in the centre of town on Pitt Street. The sorting office was very interesting: There exists only two machines to help sort the mail; the conveyor which takes the sacks from the yard to the office, and the cancelling machine which cancels or 'franks'the stamps. The rest of the work is done by hand. Each postman has a duty to perform at the office as well as delivering the mail. There are some boxes there where people pay to collect their own letters which we thought was rather strange. Mr Roy Mason M.P has a special box for his mail which then has to be sent to Sheffield to be checked for explosives. Mr Young, who showed us round expected all the mail to be sent to Sheffield soon: (cont'd on page 17)
